intro: Aframomum fragrans, commonly known as the fragrant cardamom, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the ginger family (Zingiberaceae) and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and striking red-orange flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1-2 meters and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine and as a spice, similar to true cardamom. The plant's botanical features make it a valuable species in both horticulture and ethnobotanical research.
